page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The defined area has changed little over the centuries.The blue/grey marls which form the lowest part of the lias clays of the Jurassic group have formed the pattern of low hills between the{Cotswolds}and their outlier{Bredon Hill}in the broad area known as the{Severn}plain.The clays have resulted in the medieval field patterns being undisturbed by modern ploughs.Sheep have grazed for centuries on the high ridges and deep furrows which are clearly visible. The settlement pattern is of scattered villages,(largest consisting of 78 dwellings)which are small and irregular in form and a few isolated farms.
